page.title: 03WASTELAND AREAS
page.content: Primary industrial developments by man particularly in the coal mining and fire clay workings have and are indeed still making their mark on the landscape. The former Branchal Pit {(GR. 812565),}Stonecraig Colliery{(GR. {822548),}Moss Colliery{(GR. 812552) and Bailliesmuir Pit{(GR. 824563)}have all left their scars on the landscape in the form of slag heaps, although the last mentioned has been landscaped Also there are various water features associated with old mine workings e.g {(GR. 822550)}which contains hot water due to contact with burning coal. A few fire clay pits scar the landscape and the remains of disused works are to be seen in some locations e.g{(GR. {824549)
